comment._content: This is Shamrock IV, one of Sir Thomas Lipton's racing yachts. She was on her way across the Atlantic for the America's Cup when war broke out. Nine of the crew were detained in Bermuda and sent off to war. The photo was taken at Shewan Shipyard at the foot of 27th St in Brooklyn. The yacht was put into storage until the war was over. "Shamrock IV. Here; War Halts Trials", NYT, 18 August 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00C12F93C5913738...
